chargeHist.descr: Possess THC  with intent to deliver (>2500-10,000 g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant John P. KUBICHEK Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC w/ Intent to deliver (>1000-2500 grams), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Execution of sentence is stayed and the defendant is placed on probation to DOC.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Obtain GED within the first six months of probation.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No association with any known drug dealers or users.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law.

Additional eight (8) months county jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

records.addlTxt:
The State files an Amended Information which amends the charge to possess THC with intent to deliver (1000-2500 grams), contrary to Section 961.41(1m)(h)3, a Class G felony.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation be completed by the Department of Corrections.
PSI is due to the court on 03-18-16.
Sentencing is set for 03-29-16 at 1:30 p.m.
The Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample.
